intro: Hoorebekia carthamoides, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Hoorebekia carthamoides is often considered a weed but can provide nectar for pollinators.
